text.p: British vaccine research firm Peptide Therapeutics Group Plc said on Monday it named chief executive Alan Goodman as deputy chairman as well as regional director, North America.
Finance director John Brown was named chief executive, the company said in a statement.
Sir Brian Richards, currently chairman, will become non-executive chairman.
Gordon Cameron, who joined the firm last year from NM Rothschild, was appointed finance director, and Nick Higgins, currently licensing director, was named commercial director.
Daniel Roach, currently commercial director, and Andy Allars, non-executive director, planned to stand down, the company said.
The changes were set to take effect from March 1.

"The management changes being announced today ensure that we have the right balance of experience and flair in our senior management team to take the company forward into its next stage of development," Brown said in the statement.
